data.title: The Association of Aquatic Professionals
data.meta_description: Pool Safely is a national public education campaign developed by the CPSC to reduce child drownings, non-fatal submersions, and entrapments in public swimming
data.text:
The American Red Cross teaches people of all ages and various abilities how to swim and be safe around the water. In addition, the Red Cross provides comprehensive training for lifeguards, instructors and aquatic facility management to help protect aquatic facility patrons.

The International Swimming Hall of Fame is a not-for-profit educational organization that promotes the benefits and importance of swimming as a key to fitness, good health, quality of life, and the water safety of children through the operation of its museum and library.

Centers for Disease Control and Prevention – The CDC is working with public health and industry representatives across the United States to build a Model Aquatic Health Code (MAHC). The MAHC will serve as a model and guide for local and state agencies needing guidance to update or implement standards governing the design, construction, operation, and maintenance of swimming pools and other treated recreational water venues.

The National Safe Boating Council is the foremost coalition for the advancement and promotion of safer boating through education.

Pool and Hot Tub Alliance – is a leading educator for industry, government, and academic professionals with an interest in pools, spas and aquatic facilities. Its mission is to encourage healthier living through aquatic education and research.

PPOA serves and supports swimming pool and waterpark operators in the US and now the developed world. It is dedicated to the betterment and national recognition of professional pool operators who excel in this profession.

SCPPOA provides a forum where professionals come together to network and exchange ideas. It also provides leadership roles in the establishment of standards of care in aquatics, aquatic education and training and aquatic experts and resources.

The mission of the Coalition is to research, identify and promote evidence-based standards for lifeguarding and water rescue. The Coalition is a collaborative effort of the American Red Cross, the United States Lifesaving Association and the YMCA of the USA
